Network module

class network.Connection(node1: Node, node2: Node, canvas: Canvas)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a connection between two nodes, visualized as a line on the canvas.

Variables:

  • nodes (list[Node]) – A list of the two nodes connected by the connection.

  • canvas (tkinter.Canvas) – The canvas object to draw the connection on.

  • connectionLine (int) – The id of the line object on the canvas.

check()[source]

Updates the visual representation of the connection based on the nodes’ states.

getFirstNode()[source]
Returns:

The first node in the nodes[] list.

Return type:

Node

getSecondNode()[source]
Returns:

The second node in the nodes[] list.

Return type:

Node

hasNode(node: Node)[source]
Parameters:

node (Node) – The node to check.

Returns:

True -> node is in the nodes[] list, False -> node is not in the nodes[] list.

Return type:

bool

class network.Map(canvas)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a simulation map, responsible for handling the creation of nodes and connections, as well as the simulation loop.

Variables:

  • canvas (tkinter.Canvas) – The canvas object to draw the nodes and connections on.

  • numberOfNodes (int) – The number of nodes in the simulation.

  • avgNodeDegree (int) – The average number of connections each node should have.

  • initialOutbreakSize (int) – The number of nodes to infect at the start of the simulation.

  • speed (int) – Time for each tick in milliseconds.

  • width (int) – width of the map

  • height (int) – height of the map

  • connections (list[Connection]) – A list of connections between nodes.

  • nodes (list[Node]) – A list of nodes in the simulation.

  • isLoaded (bool) – True -> map is loaded, False -> not loaded.

  • isEnd (bool) – True -> simulation has ended, False -> simulation si running

createConnections()[source]
Creates connections between nodes based on the average node degree.

  • calculates the total number of connections needed based on avgNodeDegree and numberOfNodes

  • randomly selects a node and finds the nearest node to connect to

  • checks if the nearest node is already int the neighbors[] list of the selected node

    • if not, creates a connection between the two nodes

  • repeats until the total number of connections is reached

createMap()[source]

Creates nodes based with random positions on the canvas.

getDistance(node1, node2)[source]

Calculates the Euclidean distance between two nodes.

Parameters:

  • node1 (Node) – The first node.

  • node2 (Node) – The second node.

Returns:

The Euclidean distance between the two nodes.

Return type:

float

infectNodes()[source]

Infects nodes at the start of the simulation based on the initial outbreak size.

isMapLoaded()[source]
Returns:

isLoaded attribute of the Map object

Return type:

bool

reset()[source]

Resets the map, clearing the canvas and nodes[] list.

setup(speed, numberOfNodes, avgNodeDegree, initialOutbreakSize, virusSpreadChance, virusCheckFreq, recoveryChance, gainResistChance)[source]

  • Sets up the map and attributes for the simulation with the given parameters.

  • Calls the createMap(), createConnections(), and infectNodes() methods to properly setup map.

  • At the end performs the initial tick() and check() for each node to visually display the initial state of the simulation.

tick()[source]
Handles the simulation loop.

  • calls the tick() and check() method for each node in the nodes[] list

  • checks if the simulation has ended (no more infected nodes)

  • if the simulation has ended, runs two more ticks and checks to prevent the visual representation from freezing

class network.Node(canvas, x: int, y: int, state: State, virusSpreadChance, virusCheckFreq, recoveryChance, gainResistChance)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a device in the simulation that can be in one of the following states: SUSCEPTIBLE, INFECTED, RECOVERED, or RESISTANT.

Variables:

  • canvas (tkinter.Canvas) – The canvas object to draw the node on.

  • x (int) – The x coordinate of the node.

  • y (int) – The y coordinate of the node.

  • state (State) – The current state of the node.

  • nextState (State) – The next state of the node.

  • virusSpreadChance (float) – The chance of the virus spreading to a neighbor node.

  • virusCheckFreq (int) – The number of ticks between each check if node is infected.

  • recoveryChance (float) – The chance of an infected node recovering from the virus.

  • gainResistChance (float) – The chance of a infected node gaining resistance to the virus.

  • tickCount (int) – The number of ticks since the node was created.

  • connections (list[Connection]) – A list of connections to neighboring nodes.

  • neighbors (list[Node]) – A list of neighboring nodes.

  • width (int) – The width of the circle representing the node.

  • circle (int) – The id of the circle object on the canvas.

addConnection(connection: Connection, neighbor: Node)[source]

Adds connection to the connections[] list and neighbor to the neighbors[] list if neighbor is not already in the neighbors[] list.

Parameters:

  • connection (Connection) – The connection to add.

  • neighbor (Node) – The neighbor node to add.

becomeResistant()[source]

Sets the nodes state to RESISTANT and the circle color to grey.

check()[source]

Based on the current state of the node, updates the next state of the node.

createConnection(neighbor: Node)[source]

Creates a connection between this node and a neighbor node.

Parameters:

neighbor (Node) – The neighboring node to connect to.

Returns:

True -> connection was created, False -> neighbor is already in neighbors[] list.

Return type:

bool

getDegree()[source]
Returns:

The number of neighbors.

Return type:

int

getState()[source]
Returns:

The current state of the node.

Return type:

State

infect()[source]

Sets the circle color to red and infects neighboring nodes based on the virus spread chance.

isNeighbor(node: Node)[source]

Checks if the given node is a neighbor of this node.

Parameters:

node (Node) – The node to check.

Returns:

True -> node is a neighbor, False -> node is not a neighbor.

Return type:

bool

recover()[source]

Sets the nodes nextState to SUSCEPTIBLE and the circle color to blue.

setNextState(state: State)[source]

Sets the next state of the node if the current state is not RESISTANT.

Parameters:

state (State) – The state to set.

setState(state: State)[source]

Sets current state of the node.

Parameters:

state (State) – The state to set.

tick()[source]

  • Calls appropriate methods to update node based on the current state of the node.

  • If tickCount is a multiple of virusCheckFreq, the node checks if it is infected.

  • Sets the state of the node to the next state.

class network.State[source]

Bases: object

Represents the different possible states a node can be in during the simulation.

Variables:

  • SUSCEPTIBLE (int) – Node can be infected by virus

  • INFECTED (int) – Node is infected by virus

  • RECOVERED (int) – Node has recovered from virus

  • RESISTANT (int) – Node is resistant to virus

INFECTED = 2
RECOVERED = 3
RESISTANT = 4
SUSCEPTIBLE = 1
